11.verification_summary: The claim plausibly describes a common econometric issue where a dominant low-frequency trend in postwar data can obscure long-run elasticities and inflate uncertainty in asymptotic confidence regions, though exact applicability depends on context and model specification

12.verification_summary: Based solely on the claim text, the conclusion emphasizes long run stability, data span importance, and multi estimator approach, with caution about postwar samples.
